info.title: Castor EDC API Documentation

scopes.study_statistics: Grants access to a study's statistics
scopes.record: Grants access to the data for a single participant; intended for use by study subjects

get.summary: Retrieve list of audit trail entries based on input criteria.Please note that this endpoint is currently in beta and implementation details may change.

parameters.name: study_id
parameters.description: The ID of the study for which this call should be made

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page to retrieve

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The size of pages

parameters.name: date_from
parameters.description: Start of date range

parameters.name: date_to
parameters.description: End of date range

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: Actor of audit trail entry, "," separated.

parameters.name: event_types
parameters.description: Event types to be returned, "," separated. Event "audit_trail_viewed" must be requested explicitly to be returned.

200.description: List of all audit trail entries of the Study in a given timeframe

422.description: Unprocessable entity - see error details for more information.

get.summary: Retrieve participant survey compliance information
get.description: Retrieves participant survey compliance. Result is based on the site permissions of the API user.

parameters.name: study_id
parameters.description: The ID of the study for which this call should be made

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page to retrieve

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The size of pages

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The field to sort on, the default is `participantId`. All available ones are: siteName, participantId, participantStatus, compliance, totalSurveys, completedSurveys

parameters.name: dir
parameters.description: Sorting direction of the results ASC or DESC, defaults to ASC

parameters.name: participantId[]
parameters.description: Returns compliance result filtered on given participants.

parameters.name: availabilityStart
parameters.description: Returns all surveys available for completion between availabilityStart and availabilityEnd dates. Supported format Y-m-d H:i:s

parameters.name: availabilityEnd
parameters.description: Returns all surveys available for completion between availabilityStart and availabilityEnd dates Supported format Y-m-d H:i:s

parameters.name: siteId[]
parameters.description: Returns compliance result filtered on given sites.

parameters.name: participantStatus[]
parameters.description: Returns compliance result filtered on given participant statuses.

parameters.name: surveyPackageId[]
parameters.description: Returns compliance result filtered on given survey packages.

parameters.name: surveyPackageStatus[]
parameters.description: Returns compliance result filtered on survey package status. Available ones are: Created, Completed, Failed, In Progress, Locked, Received, Sent, Viewed

parameters.name: mobile
parameters.description: Filter on mobile surveys. Requires mobile surveys to be enabled on the study.

parameters.name: compliance
parameters.description: Compliance percentage to filter on, integer between 0 and 100. Requires complianceOption to be set.

parameters.name: complianceOption
parameters.description: Logical operator to be combined with "compliance" parameter.

parameters.name: parentId
parameters.description: UUID of the visit or repeating data survey parent. Requires the "parentType" parameter.

parameters.name: parentType
parameters.description: 0: No parent. 1: Surveys belongs to a visit. 2: The surveys belongs to a repeating data instance.

200.description: List of compliance information

403.description: No site permissions.

get.summary: Retrieves the list of all available fields
get.description:
Gets `Field` objects.
Always requires a study_id to be given. Can be paged.
Returns HalJson responses (with _links for paging and to single objects).

parameters.name: study_id
parameters.description: The ID of the study for which this call should be made

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page to retrieve

parameters.name: include
parameters.description:
The extra properties to include in the Field array.
Currently it supports 'metadata', 'validations', 'optiongroup', 'dependencies'.
List separated by ','. Use like: ?include=metadata,validations,optiongroup.
Separation by '|' is deprecated and will be removed in the next major release.

200.description: List of all fields of the Study

get.summary: Retrieve a single Field
get.description: Returns HalJson objects (with _links).

parameters.name: study_id
parameters.description: The ID of the study for which this call should be made

parameters.name: field_id
parameters.description: Field ID of the field to fetch

parameters.name: include
parameters.description:
The extra properties to include in the Field array.
Currently it supports 'metadata', 'validations', 'optiongroup', 'dependencies'.
List separated by ','. Use like: ?include=metadata,validations,optiongroup.
Separation by '|' is deprecated and will be removed in the next major release.

200.description: Single Field

200.description: List of all repeating data instances of the Study

post.summary: Creates a repeating data instance.
post.description:
Creates an instance of Repeating Data for a specific Participant. Repeating Data Instances are the objects on which data points are stored and are required to be created before that happens. They can have a custom name that has to be unique within a given participant.
Repeating Data Instances can have a parent defined to create a tree-like structure of parent/child information elements. Parents can be either a visit or another repeating data instance and have to be defined with parent_type and parent_id.
To store data on repeated measures repeating data, the parent_type and parent_id should always point to the visit or repeating data instance on which the repeated measure field is present.

parameters.name: study_id
parameters.description: The ID of the study to create a repeating data instance for

parameters.name: participant_id
parameters.description: The ID of the participant to create a repeating data instance for

parameters.name: repeating_data_instance
parameters.description: Repeating Data Instance details to create the object.

400.description: Could not create the repeating data instance due to a domain error. See the errors/detail property for additional information.

403.description: No permissions to create the repeating data instance or the repeating data is blinded. See the errors/detail property for additional information.

404.description: Participant or repeating data not found. See the errors/detail property for additional information.

post.summary: Creates a collection of repeating data instances.
post.description:
Creates a collection of repeating data instances for a specific participant. Repeating data instances are the objects on which data points are stored and are required to be created before that happens. They can have a custom name that has to be unique within a given participant.
Repeating data instances can have a parent defined to create a tree-like structure of parent/child information elements. Parents can be either a visit or another repeating data instance and have to be defined with parent_type and parent_id.
To store data on repeated measures repeating data, the parent_type and parent_id should always point to the visit or repeating data instance on which the repeated measure field is present.

parameters.name: study_id
parameters.description: The ID of the study to create the repeating data instances for

parameters.name: participant_id
parameters.description: The ID of the participant to create the repeating data instances for

parameters.name: repeating_data_instance_collection
parameters.description: Repeating data instance collection data with the details to create them.

400.description: Could not create the repeating data instances due to a domain error. See the errors/detail property for additional information.

403.description: No permissions to create the repeating data instances or the repeating data instances are blinded. See the errors/detail property for additional information.

422.description: Duplicate name for repeating data instance

200.description: List of all field values for a participant.

parameters.description: Filter survey package invitations based on participant id. Cannot be combined with "ccr_patient_id"

parameters.description: Filter survey package invitations based on CCR patient id. Cannot be combined with "participant_id"

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The field to sort on, the default is `createdOn`. All available ones are: availableFrom, progress, createdOn, updatedOn, sentOn, locked, archived, record_id, siteName, survey_package_name, status, finishedOn, startedOn, isMobile, expiresOn

parameters.name: dir
parameters.description: Sorting direction of the results ASC or DESC, defaults to ASC

parameters.name: available_from_start
parameters.description: Filter on survey `available_from` field based on a date range. Requires available_from_end. Supported format Y-m-d H:i:s

parameters.name: available_from_end
parameters.description: Filter on survey `available_from` field based on a date range. Requires available_from_start. Supported format Y-m-d H:i:s

parameters.name: available
parameters.description: If the survey is available based on the current server datetime.

parameters.name: repeatable
parameters.description: Filter on surveys that have been generated from a repeatable survey.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Status to filter on - available ones are: Created, Completed, Failed, In Progress, Locked, Received, Sent, Viewed

parameters.name: finished_on
parameters.description: Filter survey package invitations based on finished date. Multiple modifiers can be applied. Supported formats: 2021-03-20, 2021-03-20 12:34:56, 2021-03-20T12:34:56Z

parameters.name: finished_on[gt]
parameters.description: Filter survey package invitations that has finished date greater than provided.

parameters.name: finished_on[gte]
parameters.description: Filter survey package invitations that has finished date greater or equal to provided.

parameters.name: finished_on[lt]
parameters.description: Filter survey package invitations that has finished date lower than provided.

parameters.name: finished_on[lte]
parameters.description: Filter survey package invitations that has finished date lower or equal to provided.

200.description: List of all Survey Package Instances of the Study
